revised_title: Surface States and Neutral Hydrogen Interaction with Solid Surfaces: A Non-Perturbative Approach
tldr: This article presents a non-perturbative approach to study the interaction of neutral hydrogen with solid surfaces. The authors derive the effective interaction Hamiltonian and explore the case of small but finite distances using the numerical solution of a Schrödinger equation. The results demonstrate the involvement of surface states weakly bound to the material surface, providing insights into the properties of the system and the inadequacy of perturbative techniques.
